job_tasks.phrase: We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates the team's function within the broader company context and their support for specific business domains (SEO).

job_tasks.phrase: We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products.
job_tasks.justification: This explains how the ML team's work directly enables other teams to build products, demonstrating alignment with business objectives.

job_tasks.phrase: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring
job_tasks.justification: This describes the end-to-end process of model development, encompassing research, experimentation, and deployment.
This explicitly lists core machine learning modeling tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Working with LLM: Embeddings, prompt engineering, model fine-tuning
job_tasks.justification: This highlights specific generative AI modeling techniques.

job_tasks.phrase: Supporting the infrastructure for conducting experiments, storing results, retraining models, quality monitoring, and alerting
job_tasks.justification: This directly describes MLOps activities related to managing the ML lifecycle.
Interacting with APIs often involves software development practices for integration.
Deployment and monitoring are key components of MLOps.
FastAPI is a web framework for building APIs, which falls under software development.

soft_skills.phrase: turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic.
Full project development cycle: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring
We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain.
We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products.
It's up to you to decide what work format works best for you.

classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes traditional ML tasks such as classification, ranking, regression, and clustering models. While LLM work is mentioned, it's in conjunction with broader ML development and doesn't form the sole focus, unlike a dedicated GenAI role.
